page.title: 15CHARLTON-HANK.FARMING 1
page.content: There are 13 mixed farms in the area. Most have one main enterprise with one or two lesser lines.Most of the farms are family run;9 are privately owned and 4 are rented from the Charlton Park estate.{Prices:}land,house & buildings Â£2000 per acre.Rent approx Â£55 per acre.Only 5 people are employed on these farms outside the family.Minimum basic wage is Â£82.80 per week of 38 hours.{WOOD}Some 220 acres are mixed woodland mainly conifer with oak,chestnut & sycamore.Most of the wood is sold for pit props and fencing material.{BEEF Six of the farms rear beef cattle.Most are Friesian-cross- Hereford with a few Charolais ,approx 20 head per farm selling at market at 92p.per kilo.{LAMB}Only one farm has sheep with 120 ewes which are mules and 2 Suffolk rams.Lamb price 147p.per kilo.
